benchmark_details.name: BESPOKE (Benchmark for Search-Augmented Large Language Model Personalization via Diagnostic Feedback)
benchmark_details.overview: BESPOKE is a realistic benchmark designed for evaluating personalization in search-augmented LLMs, constructed from authentic user history sessions and human-annotated preference scores and feedback.
benchmark_details.data_type: chat and search history pairs with preference annotations

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate personalization in search-augmented LLMs and provide a clear framework for benchmarking their effectiveness in understanding and adapting to user preferences.

data.source: Created through long-term human annotation involving active daily use of chat and search systems by diverse user profiles.
data.annotation: Manual annotation by human annotators who provided feedback on the responses generated.

methodology.calculation: Calculated using a 5-point Likert scale based on human annotator ratings.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores indicate better alignment of model responses with user needs and preferences.
methodology.validation: Validated through comparisons with existing benchmarks and qualitative assessments by human evaluators.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: User histories were de-identified and handled to ensure no personally identifiable information is disclosed.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.consent_procedures: Informed consent was obtained from all human annotators prior to participation.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.compliance_with_regulations: The study follows ethical standards for data protection and privacy.
